quote.#text: Honoring the Nation’s First Responders Day

official-title.#text: Expressing support for designation of October 28, annually, as

sponsor.#tail: submitted the following concurrent resolution; which was referred to the

quote.#text: Honoring the Nation’s First Responders Day

text.#text:
honors and recognizes the contributions of volunteer firefighters, policemen, and other service men
			 and women; and

quote.#tail:
with appropriate ceremonies and activities that promote awareness of the contributions of the
			 Nation’s First Responders.
quote.#text: Honoring the Nation’s First Responders Day

text.#text: encourages the people of the United States to observe

Whereas the term first responders includes all fire, police, EMT, and volunteer first responder
			 workers in the United States;

Whereas there are over 25,300,000 first responders in the United States today, working to keep our
			 communities safe;

Whereas first responders, both professional and volunteer, deserve to be recognized for their
			 commitment to safety, defense, and honor; and

quote.#text: Honoring the Nation’s First Responders Day

text.#text: Whereas October 28 would be an appropriate day to establish as

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HCON 89 IH: Expressing support for designation of October 28, annually, as “Honoring the Nation’s First Responders Day”.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
